summary: This document is an email chain between federal prosecutors from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing coordination around Deutsche Bank's response to subpoenas related to Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutors note Deutsche Bank is not a subject or target but has been responsive, and they are trying to schedule a meeting to discuss the bank's relationship with Epstein.

persons.name: Tam LaMorte
persons.context: Appears as a recipient and sender in the email chain, coordinating a meeting time to discuss Deutsche Bank's subpoena results related to Epstein.

persons.name: Sebastian Swett
persons.context: Initiates and participates in the email chain regarding Deutsche Bank's relationship with Epstein, offering to host a meeting and noting his availability.

persons.name: Tara LaMorte
persons.context: Appears as a recipient and sender in the email chain, asking if others are available to chat about Deutsche Bank.

persons.name: Sheb Swett
persons.context: Signs the initial email inquiring about discussions with Deutsche Bank regarding its relationship with Epstein, noting an overlapping investigation into the bank.

connections.description: Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York coordinating on the Deutsche Bank/Epstein matter.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing meeting times regarding Deutsche Bank subpoena results.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys at the same office; Sheb initiates the inquiry about Deutsche Bank, and Sebastian is part of the coordination.

events.title: Email Coordination on Deutsche Bank Subpoena
events.description: Federal prosecutors from the SDNY exchange emails to schedule a meeting to discuss subpoena results received from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein materials.

locations: U.S. Attorneys Office for the Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was providing subpoena results to federal prosecutors regarding Jeffrey Epstein materials as of July 2019.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York stated they did not consider Deutsche Bank a subject or target in connection with their work with Epstein.
Prosecutors noted Deutsche Bank had been 'very responsive' to their requests.
The SDNY had an ongoing investigation into Deutsche Bank that overlapped with the Epstein matter.
